long_answers.question: Long answer question 1 based on World Heritage.
long_answers.answer: World Heritage Sites are places recognized by UNESCO for their outstanding value. They may be cultural, natural or mixed in nature. The idea of protecting such sites began in the twentieth century. UNESCO launched campaigns to save important monuments and sites. The World Heritage Committee evaluates and selects sites. Selected sites receive international recognition and protection. Some sites are endangered due to war or natural disasters. Preserving these sites promotes tourism and cultural awareness.
